Issues.Title: Could not find Windows Runtime type Microsoft.Toolkit.Win32.UI.XamlHost.IXamlMetadataContainer
Issues.Body:
# Could not find Windows Runtime type Microsoft.Toolkit.Win32.UI.XamlHost.IXamlMetadataContainer As a proof of concept I am trying to build a simple WPF, C#, .Net Core 3.0 application, using Xaml Islands NuGet packages (Microsoft.Windows.SDK.Contracts and Microsoft.Toolkit.Wpf.UI.XamlHost) and "Windows Application Packaging Project C#". When I add the following two lines to MainWindow.xaml: xmlns:
XamlHost="clr-namespace:Microsoft.Toolkit.Wpf.UI.XamlHost;
assembly=Microsoft.Toolkit.Wpf.UI.XamlHost" x:Name="xamlHost"
InitialTypeName="Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Button"
ChildChanged="WindowsXamlHost_ChildChanged"/>

## Error "XamlHost:WindowsXamlHost" has a blue line under it with the following error:
"Could not find Windows Runtime type Microsoft.Toolkit.Win32.UI.XamlHost.IXamlMetadataContainer".

## Research I did some research on GitHub and I found this file for WinForms [here](https://github.com/windows-toolkit/Microsoft.Toolkit.Win32/blob/master/Microsoft.Toolkit.Forms.UI.XamlHost/WindowsXamlHostBase.cs)

Microsoft.Toolkit.Win32/Microsoft.Toolkit.Forms.UI.XamlHost/WindowsXamlHostBase.cs
namespace Microsoft.Toolkit.Forms.UI.XamlHost
public abstract partial class WindowsXamlHostBase : ContainerControl
private static readonly IXamlMetadataContainer _metadataContainer;

>THIS FILE DOES NOT EXIST FOR WPF!
## Sofware used to build the application:
  • Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2019 Preview (version 16.2.0 Preview 2.0).
  • Windows 10 Pro 1903 OS Build 18362.10005
  • Target Framework .Net Core 3.0
  • Windows Application Packaging
    • Target version: Windows 10. version 1903 (10.0; Build 18362)
    • Min version: Windows 10. version 1903 (10.0; Build 18362)
  • NuGet Packages
    • Microsoft.Windows.SDK.Contracts
    • Microsoft.Toolkit.Wpf.UI.XamlHost

Here is the remainder of the code, but the error occurs before I can build the project.  Also note that I got this to work without an issue using the WPF, C#, .Net Framework 4.7.2.  I manually loaded the contracts from my PC and used the stable versions of the NuGet Package: Microsoft.Toolkit.Wpf.UI.XamlHost.

MainWindow.xaml.cs
using Microsoft.Toolkit.Wpf.UI.XamlHost;
private void WindowsXamlHost_ChildChanged(object sender, System.EventArgs e)
{ WindowsXamlHost windowsXamlHost = (WindowsXamlHost)sender; Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Button button = (Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Button)windowsXamlHost.Child; if (button == null) //When the window is closed, this method will be executed again. return; button.Content = "My UWP button"; button.Click += Button_Click; }

private void Button_Click(object sender, Windows.UI.Xaml.RoutedEventArgs e)
{
MessageBox.Show("My UWP button works");
}
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Could not find Windows Runtime type Microsoft.Toolkit.Win32.UI.XamlHost.IXamlMetadataContainer" (#1290)

Issues.Title: Need a way to suppress CS8614 in dev builds
Issues.Body:
See https://github.com/dotnet/roslyn/issues/37281 for context 

After upgrading to Dev16.2.0 Preview 4 builds, local builds would start failing with CS8614 at [dotnet/wpf:SortDescriptionCollection.cs#L138](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/ae1790531c3b993b56eba8b1f0dd395a3ed7de75/src/Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf/src/WindowsBase/System/ComponentModel/SortDescriptionCollection.cs#L138)

In order to continue building successfully (until the roslyn/corefx issue is resolved), we need to set `NoWarn=8614`. This can not be supplied from `msbuild` commandline durectly via `/p:NoWarn=8614` because doing so will override the `<NoWarn>...</NoWarn>` settings already specifified in project files. 

We need a way to specify an additional warning-filter in the commandline for diagnostics/dev builds.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Need a way to suppress CS8614 in dev builds" (#1289)

Issues.Title: `AdditionalNoWarn` support for diagnostic builds/debugging/dev-builds
Issues.Body:
See https://github.com/dotnet/roslyn/issues/37281 for context 

After upgrading to Dev16.2.0 Preview 4 builds, local builds would start failing with CS8614 at [dotnet/wpf:SortDescriptionCollection.cs#L138](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/ae1790531c3b993b56eba8b1f0dd395a3ed7de75/src/Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf/src/WindowsBase/System/ComponentModel/SortDescriptionCollection.cs#L138)

. In order to continue building successfully (until the roslyn/corefx issue is resolved), we need to supply `/p:AdditionalNoWarn:8614` 

Fixes #1289
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "`AdditionalNoWarn` support for diagnostic builds/debugging/dev-builds" (#1288)

Issues.Title: Cleanup System.Security.Permissions using directives and more comments
Issues.Body:
Issue #1108 
Cleaned up `System.Security.Permissions` using directives and more permission related comments.
Also removed the PackageReference to `System.Security.Permissions` from the `TestProjects.targets` file

Ran full DRT pass and verified that everything is at baseline
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Cleanup System.Security.Permissions using directives and more comments" (#1272)

Issues.Title: WIP: Remove support for `UseLegacyDangerousClipboardDeserializationMode`
Issues.Body:
Remove support for `UseLegacyDangerousClipboardDeserializationMode` and permanently disallow deserialization of dangerous types.

- Removes support for AppContext flag `UseLegacyDangerousClipboardDeserializationMode`
- Permanently limits clipboard-deserialziation to primitive non-text types only.

Fixes #1132

PS: Creating a WIP PR since this hasn't gone through enough testing yet.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "WIP: Remove support for `UseLegacyDangerousClipboardDeserializationMode`" (#1286)

Issues.Title: Update localized strings that render \r\n as text
Issues.Body:
**Problem description:**
When you use an Open File Dialog and provide an invalid file OR if you use a Save File Dialog and try to overwrite an existing file the messagebox renders the \r\n as text instead of  a line break.

See issue #977 for a full description. 

Confirmed these updates fix File Dialog messages in English and German.  (Fixes #977.)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Update localized strings that render \r\n as text" (#1285)

Issues.Title: Enable SplashScreen build-action for .NET Core 3.0
Issues.Body:
Fixes #299 

WinFX.targets has a condition for preventing `SplashScreen` build-action from running on .NET Framework 3.0 - which is specified overly broadly.

Rewriting this condition to be more specific fixes the problem and brings the `SplashScreen` build action back to .NET Core 3.0.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Enable SplashScreen build-action for .NET Core 3.0" (#1276)

Issues.Title: MediaPlayer stops playing altought it should loop
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MediaPlayer stops playing altought it should loop" (#1284)

Issues.Title: AttachedPropertyBrowsableForType attribute need to be added
Issues.Body:
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
In .NET Framework, we use AttachedPropertyBrowsableForType attribute to show attach property in Visual Studio property window in design time.
```
[AttachedPropertyBrowsableForType(typeof(UIElement))] 
public static double GetAngle(DependencyObject obj)
{
       return (double)obj.GetValue(AngleProperty);
}
```
Now in .NET Core, it seems not support this property. 
But I can see .NET Core support AttachedPropertyBrowsableForChildren attribute.

Can we add this attribute or is there any workaround? thanks a lot!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "AttachedPropertyBrowsableForType attribute need to be added" (#1280)

Issues.Title: Fixing MAS Compliance Issues
Issues.Body:
Fixes #791, #1015 

This pull request contains two changes.
1. Setting ScrollPattern on ComboBox to only be enabled when its dropdown is opened.
2. Ensuring that expander is added to GroupItemDataAutomationPeer if it is the only child. This ensures that the expander is accessible to screen readers.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fixing MAS Compliance Issues" (#1278)

Issues.Title: WindowChrome System.OverflowException:“Arithmetic operation resulted in an overflow.”
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: (e.g. 3.0 Preview1, or daily build number, use `dotnet --info`)
3.0.100-preview6-012264
* Windows version: (`winver`)
Windows 10
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes/No
Yes,All .NET Framework 
 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
 In the case of two monitors，Order: main display 1 below, secondary display 2 above，And the resulting platform is x64，Drag the program to screen 2，A mouse click triggers this exception.
System.OverflowException:“Arithmetic operation resulted in an overflow.”
 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
 System.OverflowException
  HResult=0x80131516
  Message=Arithmetic operation resulted in an overflow.
  Source=PresentationFramework
  StackTrace:
   at System.Windows.Shell.WindowChromeWorker._HandleNCHitTest(WM uMsg, IntPtr wParam, IntPtr lParam, Boolean& handled)
   at System.Windows.Shell.WindowChromeWorker._WndProc(IntPtr hwnd, Int32 msg, IntPtr wParam, IntPtr lParam, Boolean& handled)
   at System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource.PublicHooksFilterMessage(IntPtr hwnd, Int32 msg, IntPtr wParam, IntPtr lParam, Boolean& handled)
   at MS.Win32.HwndWrapper.WndProc(IntPtr hwnd, Int32 msg, IntPtr wParam, IntPtr lParam, Boolean& handled)
   at MS.Win32.HwndSubclass.DispatcherCallbackOperation(Object o)
   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs)
   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.TryCatchWhen(Object source, Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs, Delegate catchHandler)
   at System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher.LegacyInvokeImpl(DispatcherPriority priority, TimeSpan timeout, Delegate method, Object args, Int32 numArgs)
   at MS.Win32.HwndSubclass.SubclassWndProc(IntPtr hwnd, Int32 msg, IntPtr wParam, IntPtr lParam)

 **Expected behavior:**
 Expect no exceptions, at least not crashes
 **Minimal repro:**
 Look at:
 https://stackoverflow.com/questions/50282355/why-does-my-wpf-application-crash-when-i-bump-my-mousewheel/50282356#50282356
https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/167357/overflow-exception-in-windowchrome.html
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WindowChrome System.OverflowException:“Arithmetic operation resulted in an overflow.”" (#1269)

Issues.Title: DesignerProperties.DesignStyle throws object reference exception
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0.0-preview8-27911-03
* Windows version: Win10
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: **No**

 **Problem description:**
using `DesignerProperties.DesignStyle` feature in a .NET Core 3.0 WPF project fails with an exception. Works fine in .NET Framework 4.8 WPF project.
 
 **Actual behavior:**
`Object reference not set to an instance of an object.` is thrown in Visual studio log. The designer works fine even when the exception is thrown. I can still modify the XAML and see changes but the style in DesignStyle is ignored.
 
 **Expected behavior:**
No exception and desired effect is shown in designer.
 
 **Minimal repro:**

1.  Create a new WPF .NET Core 3.0 project
2. Add a usercontrol to it
3. Add the following code 

```
<d:DesignerProperties.DesignStyle>
        <Style TargetType="UserControl">
            <Style.Setters>
                <Setter Property="Background" Value="White" />
            </Style.Setters>
        </Style>
    </d:DesignerProperties.DesignStyle>
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "DesignerProperties.DesignStyle throws object reference exception" (#1267)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[master] Update dependencies from dotnet/winforms" (#1265)

Issues.Title: Build failed while writing custom controls
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0 preview 6
* Windows version: windows 10 1809 17763.615
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: No

 **Problem description:**
Write a custom control, and build it. There's a possibility to get build error: Unknown build error, 'An item with the same key has already been added. Key: themes/generic.baml'.  
And if you build it multiple times, it might succeed.
 
 **Actual behavior:**
C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\3.0.100-preview6-012264\Sdks\Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop\targets\Microsoft.WinFX.targets(687,5): error RG1000: Unknown build error, 'An item with the same key has already been added. Key: themes/generic.baml'

 **Expected behavior:**
No errors. 

 **Minimal repro:**
[XSecControls.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/3390244/XSecControls.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Build failed while writing custom controls" (#1264)

Issues.Title: PresentationCore pdb is missing
Issues.Body: Trying with the latest nightly of .NET Core SDK 3 preview 7, in the debugger, PresentationCore.pdb isn't found. The rest of the WPF pdbs are found and I can source-step into the code, just that one appears missing.
